alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Central; Baldwin Coastal (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:25AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Baldwin and south central Escambia Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 424 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Warrington to 4 miles south of Perdido Beach to 3 miles southwest of Magnolia Springs. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Warrington, Foley, Gulf Breeze, Orange Beach, Goulding, Lillian, Myrtle Grove, Magnolia Springs, Oriole Beach, Bon Secour and Elberta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and northwestern Florida.
